summary: Ross L. Crozier, also known as Agent VAIVADA and Arthur G. Vaivada, was involved in CIA operations, including Project HUMANOID in Costa Rica. The documents span from 1952 to 1975, covering his contract extensions, operational clearance requests, agent evaluations, and suitability for contact agent work. He was considered for promotion and his file includes a historical listing of organizations identified by the Attorney General deemed subversive. The documents also mention his activities in Mexico and Havana.
significance: The provided documents do not explicitly link Ross L. Crozier to the JFK assassination. His significance lies in his involvement in CIA operations, particularly Project HUMANOID, and his role as an agent (VAIVADA) with activities spanning multiple countries and projects.
